TopicTitle: Quick guide to posting pictures on the forum.

Articles.Content:
Gonna make this short and sweet.  I see the question a lot, and explained a lot, but never a tutorial linked.

How to quickly post an image on the forums, using Imgur and CubeUpload.  (I know there are more, but Imgur is the most popular, and CubeUpload is what I use).  Any other service should be pretty similar.

Neither of these services requires an account, but it's definitely helpful if you ever need to access the links again.

Edit: CubeUpload currently requires registration due to an insane abuse of the guest upload system.

 

Step 1: Upload your image(s).

Imgur

 

There's a green "New Post" button the top.  Click it, and the upload dialogue will appear.

 

Click on "Browse", and select your picture.

 

Click "Open", and it will bring you here:

 

Hover over the image, and click on "Copy".  This will copy the image's direct link to your clipboard.  The other copy button will give you the link to the image on Imgur.  This is not what you want.

 

CubeUpload

 

Click on "Select Images".

 

Pick your image:

 

Click on "Open".  This will then take you to the preview page.  You can select multiple images before clicking on open if you need to upload more than one.  Click on the "Start Upload" button.

 

It will upload your images one by one, and then display your options. 

 

Click on the top line below the image, right click, and select "Copy".  This will copy the image's direct link to your clipboard.

 

Step 2: Paste your image(s).

 

Go to your post, and simply paste in what you've copied.

 

The link will display briefly, then the image will appear.

 

If you double click on your image, you can edit its properties.  Really handy for downsizing a bunch of images consistently.

 

And that's it!

I posted examples for Imgur and CubeUpload, which is what I use.  There are plenty of image hosting sites, the process will be similar.  You can even use FB if you'd like. - This is my banner photo on FB.

Edit: FB works, but it appears their direct image URLs change over time, so it won't be permanent.

Recently discovered that you can literally just drag your pictures into the post editor.

This may be dependent on browser support.  This is not the image host or forum doing it, it's your browser.

Just click and hold, hover over the tab with the forum, then release it in the edit box.  (You must have clicked in the editor to open it before you drag.)

When you upload an image to imgur, it creates an "album" automatically. With one image, it's just a bandwidth-hogging wrapper, but if you upload multiple images at once, or use the "add another image" button, it adds that to the album. 

This is what it looks like if we...

Copy and paste what is already in the address bar right after upload:

https://imgur.com/a/WCnc3uk

Copy everything after /a/ in the URL, then post it into the imgur button in the editor (IIRC this is broken):

Album WCnc3uk will appear when post is submitted

RMB > open link (or image, or copy image address) in new tab > copy url > paste in editor:

RMB > copy image > paste in editor:

(Note that with the above, there appears to be no difference whether or not you zoom in)

Get share links > embed in HTML > paste in editor:

<blockquote class="imgur-embed-pub" lang="en" data-id="jVziRV1"><a href="//imgur.com/jVziRV1">View post on imgur.com</a></blockquote><script async src="//s.imgur.com/min/embed.js" charset="utf-8"></script>

Get share links > BBCode > paste in editor:

Get share links > Markdown > paste in editor:

[Imgur](https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1.png)

In the forums editor: Insert other media > insert image from url > paste a direct link to the image (ending in .jpg, .png, etc):

Selecting the image from the thumbnail view on you account (YourAccountName > images) you can also directly copy the direct link. And you can copy resized versions of the image. You can also do this by appending a letter to the image id (numbers and letters before .png) i.e.

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1.png is original

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1s.png is small and square

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1b.png is bigger and square

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1t.png is a small thumbnail

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1m.png is a medium thumbnail

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1l.png is a large thumbnail

https://i.imgur.com/jVziRV1h.png is huge thumbnail

You can also resize by edit on imgur, but I prefer to use the forum's resize tools instead if I need to.

In short, it matters very little which of imgur's many layers of sharing systems (and at least two redesigns) you use.
